turns.content: Are there any experimental treatment plans?

There are several experimental treatment options for diabetes and chronic kidney disease that are currently being studied in clinical trials. These may include new medications, new drug combinations, and new approaches to therapy such as stem cell therapy and gene therapy. For example, there are several investigational drugs that are being studied for their potential to slow the progression of kidney disease in people with diabetes. Additionally, researchers are exploring new ways to use existing medications, such as using GLP-1 receptor agonists to protect the kidneys.

It is also important to note that some of these experimental treatments may not be widely available or covered by insurance. It would be best for this individual to discuss with their healthcare provider about participating in clinical trials that may be appropriate for their condition.
